Title: GB-Shropshire: DONV 005 - Landscape & Visual Sensitivity Study
Description:
This is a contract award notice for a Landscape and Visual Sensitivity Study for Shropshire.
      
      The Study forms part of the evidence base for the Local Plan Review (LPR). It will assess the sensitivity of land around 57 settlements and up to 5 strategic sites within Shropshire to three forms of development (housing, employment, and mixed use) and identify effective mitigation measures as appropriate. The conclusions of the Study will inform the selection of suitable sites for allocation in the LPR. The Study will also provide a sound basis for decision making in the determination of planning applications. 
      
      The Council is undertaking a LPR Preferred Options consultation on allocated sites in autumn 2018 and the Study will need to be completed by the end of August 2018.

Title: Green Hammerton/Cattal New Settlement
Description:
As a starting point for the preparation of the DPD, the Council is seeking to procure 	services for the preparation of a Concept Framework for the Green Hammerton/Cattal 	broad location for growth. The preparation of the Concept Framework will achieve the 	following objectives: 
•	To provide additional evidence to support the Examination of the Harrogate Local Plan, demonstrating what the broad location for growth is capable of delivering in terms of scale, spatial layout and infrastructure. 
•	To identify a preferred option (red line boundary) for the strategic allocation that can form the basis of the New Settlement DPD 
•	To bring together the main land owners and site promoters into a coordinated process of masterplanning;
•	To provide a mechanism to consult and engage with key stakeholders in the further progression of the project.

Title: GB-Colchester: Public Realm
Description:
Colchester Borough Council invites consultants to tender a submission to work with the Council on an exciting public realm and branding project which will help create a major sports and leisure destination on the northern fringe of Colchester in Essex.  We need specialist skills, bringing innovation, experience and practicality to create an identity and a strong public realm.  The requirements include costed and practical iconic hard and soft sustainable landscaping, artwork and installations, way marking, street furniture, boundaries, landmarks, lighting, sounds, creation and use of water, branding and promotion with logo, straplines, and social media recommendations.  Together the proposals will take forward the existing Master Plan ideas, and will unite and attract custom to this new leisure and sporting quarter.
The study will contribute to the landscape proposals that will be part of the planning application submission next summer, and to the reserved matters applications for sites on the south side of the A12 early next year. 
We particularly invite partnerships between consultancies and also where they can introduce ideas from outside the UK in order to bring forward the right creative and practical mix based on experience and achievements.  We invite you to respond to this brief

Title: London and Quadrant Housing Trust - Landscape Architects Framework 2020 - 2024 - AWARD
Description:
London and Quadrant Housing Trust and its subsidiary Quadrant Construction Services are one of the largest providers of affordable housing in the UK, housing over 250,000 people in more than 95,000 homes, primarily across London and the South East of England. London and Quadrant Housing Trust are tendering for the provision of Landscape Architects for London and Quadrant's Self Delivered New Build Projects to comply with the Public Contracts regulations 2015. The objective of this tender process is to establish a Framework Agreement with the tenderers and London and Quadrant Housing Trust. The dates and contract value are estimates and could be subject to change. This is tender is for Service providers only. 
      
      This is a two stage tender and both stages adhere to the time-scales as prescribed within the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 for Restricted OJEU Tenders.
      
      Stage 1: Selection Stage
      
      Click on the 'Express Interest' Button at the bottom
      
      Click on the 'Selection Stage' Tab at the top
      - Scroll to the bottom of the screen and you will be able to view the Tender Documents and access the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - For the Selection Stage you will only need to submit the Standard Selection Questionnaire
      - We will score your questionnaire and will advise you as to whether you are successful or not
      - Pricing Documents will only be available to those who have passed the Selection Stage
      
      
      Only if you have passed the Selection Stage.
      
      Stage 2: ITT Stage
      
      - Click on the 'ITT' Tab 
      - Scroll to the bottom and you will be able to access the Tender Documents
      - Tenderers will be briefed as to what they will need to submit for this tender
      
      Please allow sufficient time to submit your return by the specified dates as late returns will not be permitted. 
      
      
      Under the Framework Agreement L&Q and all companies within the L&Q Group (including, without limitation, Quadrant Construction Services) will have the option to call-off contracts with individual framework contractors as and when required. In addition, other Social Housing Providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) will also be entitled to call-off contracts under the Framework Agreement. "Social Housing Provider" for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, Registered Providers, Local Authorities and ALMOs. Such Social Housing Providers will only be entitled to call off under the Framework Agreement if L&Q consents.
      
      For information regarding this tender please contact the Framework Team via the tender portal. This tender is managed by the Framework Buying department. Please do not contact any other department within the London and Quadrant Group. Please do not contact Group Procurement for information as this Tender has been created by the Framework Buying Department.
